text: I’m trying to submit a PR for a fix to issue #986 on IJulia.jl. This version is only compatible with versions of Julia past commit #39132. I’m trying to update appveyor.yml and travis.yml to reflect that, but I’m not sure what to put for the Julia version number. 1.7 doesn’t work at all, but I don’t want to just test with “nightly”. What’s the right thing?

elements.text: I’m trying to submit a PR for a fix to issue #986 on IJulia.jl. This version is only compatible with versions of Julia past commit #39132. I’m trying to update appveyor.yml and travis.yml to reflect that, but I’m not sure what to put for the Julia version number. 1.7 doesn’t work at all, but I don’t want to just test with “nightly”. What’s the right thing?

text: Yes, `nightly` works fine, but is it ok to have that be the only version tested?

elements.text: works fine, but is it ok to have that be the only version tested?

text: that's probably a question for the maintainer

elements.text: that's probably a question for the maintainer

text: but I don't understand why would you need that.  isn't it possible to support multiple versions of Julia with conditionals?

elements.text: but I don't understand why would you need that.  isn't it possible to support multiple versions of Julia with conditionals?

text: Yes. I added a conditional, and my PR has been merged. :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: Yes. I added a conditional, and my PR has been merged.
